ed

RIMLOCK the roars of the approaching DINOBOTS were coming
> closer and with=
 that sound GRIMLOCK's optics once again started to
> darken. "Wheelie Frie=
nd!" he bellowed loudly as if trying to command

 but it was obvious that GRIMLOCK was loosing

> =
GRIMLOCK raised his head roared at the skies in frustration and anger,
> th=
e sound of it echoing across the landscape. However the optics that

OCK turned back on WHEELIE were not the ones of a friend, they

<NEW>

This was confirmation enough for WHEELI=
E that something was in control of GRIMLOCK, as if his optics had gone red.=
  All was clear now.

Dodging to the side of the sudden smash, WHEELIE went=
 to do what he did best.  "I thought GRIMLOCK was strong, but here you are =
playing to someone else's SONG!"

Dodging at long range, trying to get GRIM=
LOCK off balance, nto yet drawing his weapon, "Here I see you out for play,=
 under someone else's sway!  I thought the DINOBOTS were the strongest of h=
tem all, not playing to someone else's thrall!"

At this point, firing his =
small energon slingshot with a bolt aimed at GRIMLOCK's 'nose' in recreatio=
n of a long ago event, "And here I thought you were mad, but this is all ju=
st really sad!  I thought I would see you great, not playing to someone els=
e's skate!"

WHEELIE knew two things - that GRIMLOCK hated doing what anote=
hr told him, and that he got angry very easily.  So WHEELIE was hoping that=
 by making Grimlock as ANGRY as the little bot (relatively) could, he could=
 help GRIMLOCK shake it off..  OR DIE TRYING.
